title: https://insights.lfx.dev/  Secure Connection Failed
content:
Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to insights.lfx.dev. Cannot communicate securely with peer: no common encryption algorithm(s).

Error code: SSL_ERROR_NO_CYPHER_OVERLAP 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.
creator: oinkmoocluck66

title: A sudden Firefox update shifted focus from the game to the update window.
content: I’m not sure how you can help me, but please ensure that the update window in your browser on Ubuntu (I’m using 25.10) doesn’t automatically steal focus. I was playing SIGNALIS, and the game consistently freezes when it loses focus, which meant I couldn’t continue or save my progress. Your browser’s update window suddenly took focus away, interrupting the game. I understand this is partly an issue with the game itself, but the browser’s update window should not override the focus of other applications.
creator: innerwilds.dev

title: "Security Sandbox is disabled" pop up under toolbar
content:
I recently opened Firefox to see a new flagged warning under my toolbar that says "The security sandbox is disabled. Your configuration is unsupported and less secure."

I have gone into about:config and adjusted every security.sandbox element to see if that would change anything; it did not.

I am running on Windows 11 Home so I cannot install or properly run Windows Sandbox.

I would either like a solution to enable the sandbox once again, or just remove the notification from the toolbar.

title: Locks up the comp before it even starts
content:
No matter what I did(and I did go through all the steps suggested on line) the program locks up my computer when I would try to start it. I'm on a Windows 10 lap top ver. 19045 with a fresh reinstall of windows. 

 I tried uninstalling and reinstalling, both under user and admin rights, getting fresh install files with and without having the security and firewall on, running it under admin rights without security or firewall. I tried repairing the program before uninstalling it.  Nothing worked. The program would lock up my computer every time I tried to start it. my only choice would be to power down the computer and start over. I was looking for a browser less resource hungry than Google and not quite as intrusive. Maybe you can suggest one that works.

title: "browser doesn't support the new native filesystem API (https://web.dev/file-system-access)" when using desktop Firefox 145.0 for Windows
content:
When using desktop Firefox 145.0 for Windows to browse the demo page of Logseq, the division/button to choose a folder on my computer is missing, and the following text is in place instead.

"It seems that your browser doesn't support the new native filesystem API, please use any Chromium 86+ based browser like Chrome, Vivaldi, Edge, etc. Notice that the API doesn't support mobile browsers at the moment."
creator: heyjizhan

title: Update to new version crashes endlessly
content: Tonight I received a notice that a new version of Firefox was available and asking if I wanted to download it. It showed me the new Kit mascot so I decided to let it install. It seemed to install normally but when it tried to open what I guess is a welcome/new features page, it crashes, and just showed a prompt to try again. This continued in an endless loop and I had to shut it down. Unfortunately I no longer had a functioning version available that I could find so I downoaded the ESR version to be safe (ver 140.5.0esr) which I am now using. Somehow I was able to recover bookmarks and hopefully other saved info. Can anyone advise what has happened? I have used Firefox for many years and never had this sort of problem before. Running Windows 11 on a new Dell i7 PC.
creator: Greg_Beau

title: Bold font on pinned shortcuts and search tab in the middle
content:
I am using in css:

  • { 
   font-weight: bold !important;

}

html * {

}

Those two make almost everything bold in firefox itself besides pinned shortcuts and ddg search tab text have bold font. I use the first one on stylus to make every site font weight bold and it works.

Can someone help me make Pinned Shortcuts and Search Tab in the middle have bold font, i have tried everything I could but I cannot make those texts in bold font

title: Firefox v145 new tab page rounded corners are too big - please revert to smaller radius like v144
content:
I chose Firefox specifically because I disliked the overly rounded design trends in other browsers like Chrome. The subtle, smaller rounded corners in Firefox v144 were perfect - they looked professional and clean.

Please consider reverting to the smaller border radius from version 144.

title: Latest Update
content:
With the latest update when I open a FF browser window the title bar does not have the 3 icon for Shrink. Resize of Close. To get these to appear I much click on the tab for the window on my Taskbar to make the browser window close and then click again to reopen it at which time those 3 control are back where they should be.

Why is this happening after using the browser for many many years? This is really annoying and I do not understand what you all did to mess things up or if i can fix in on my end.

title: Firefox tab bar goes grey and Firefox is unresponsive on MacBook Air after closing cover
content: For the past few months, when I close my MacBook Air, for no particular amount of time, can be short or long, upon reopening and unlocking, I frequently find the Firefox tab bar has gone grey and Firefox is unresponsive. I quit Firefox and start it again immediately and it returns to normal operation and runs fine until I close my MacBook again. Firefox 145.0 (aarch64) with MacOS 15.6.1 (24G90) running on a MacBook Air M1 2020. Currently 33 tabs open across 3 windows. Performance is usually acceptable. Sometimes Gmail slows down, but I reload the tab, then it's OK.

title: Bar across the top, (toolbar?) contains far too many tabs
content:
The bar across the top (has "View recent browsing across Windows and devices" at the left end) has far too many remembered tabs. It's only happening on this platform (my wife's) and not on mine. Both running Windows 10, although I'm switching us both to newer platforms because of Windows 11.

There must be some way to turn off that bar in this platform, but I can't understand all the Firefox on-line help documents, because there's no place where there is a diagram indicating what that bar is called.
